reviews.sentence: A time warp to the 90s 1990s that is. Check InOur party arrived at Raffles at 10am ish of course the room was not ready we were expecting this however we were told the rooms would not ready until after 4 even though their normal check in is 2 pm. Despite discussion with the clerk checking us in there was no offer of anywhere to freshen up before the day exploring Singapore. It was only after I asked that the offer was made for a key to let us up to the pool changing area. The clerk who was checking us in while polite was very mechanical and lacked any real warmth. We had two rooms reserved and despite asking for them to be charged to two different credit cards my amex statement is telling me that they failed to do so. We got our complimentary Singapore Sling while the check in process was completed which was tasty. The Suites We had basic courtyard suites. while yes very beautiful in a historical context they are now dated and not in a good way. Our bathroom in suite 236 was really showing its age the continuous waterfall sounds radiating from the toilet set a relaxing tone throughout the suite. The paint flaking from the ceiling provided a touch of a white christmas in the heat of Singapore. All this while a 17 inch 1990s original TEAC square television ensured entertainment was supplied in the bedroom. I also noticed that our other suite got more amenities in the bathroom than we did. The beds while comfortable were comfortable in the same way that an old day bed at your Grandmas house is comfortable its seen a lot of guests and has conformed to those different shapes and sizes but could now be happily put out for retirement without it being a great loss. The butler service One of the key elements associated with Raffles was in a word disappointing. The first time I pushed the service button Raffles do nt give any phones that have a button to call the front desk or concierge just a service button which is meant to prompt a butler to come to your room resulted in a quick phone call to the room we were told someone would come to the room when the button was pressed not that I really want that but found the call strange when we were told else. The other couple of times pressing the button took so long that I ended up cancelling the call and walked to reception for the answers. The Dining and BarsWe visited The Long Bar simply for its historical value while yes a Singapore institution it was also the biggest tourist trap ever our friends who were staying in other hotels ended up being triple charged resulting in a long argument while it was sorted out even then no apology was offered. We had breakfast included in the Tipin Room which was delightful and a highlight of our stay. We also had lunch at Ah Tengs bakery which was tasty and also not a meal that would require a second house loan compared to the other establishments onsite. The PolThe pool was a beautiful tranquil oasis and a lovely temperature despite lacking anything mind blowing in terms of design or style. Check OutWe requested late check out and got 2 pm which satisfied us to have a swim and enjoy some more time by the pool. We fell asleep by the pool which resulted in us waking up at 155 we rushed back to our room in order to shower and change however at 205 we got a call which pretty much demanded us to get out. I informed the caller that we would be 10 minutes and could they send a bell boy for the luggage. No bell boy appeared and it took a second call to get someone there delaying us to leave the room even further if they were in such a rush to take it back they should of been helping us get out. As our flight was not until much later in the evening we asked them to store our bags. I was upset to find that they just place the bags in an open to the elements patio off the main courtyard. It was not secure at all and to be frank it was not even really in eye sight of the bell boys who were caught up in taking care of the taxi lines. I actually walked into the area to place something in my bag that I had purchased when I could not get the attention of the bell boys. I informed the clerk checking us out about the issues in our room however she did not seem to care. Overall glad I have ticked it off the bucket list but I wo nt be rushing back and will be sticking to the Fairmont across the road its a lot better value.

Timeless. We enjoyed a week at Raffles. The service was impeccable. The restaurants and bars were all first rate and only let down by some guests who failed to dress appropriately. The pool on the roof was great during the day and service outstanding by the pool barman. It was a haven to come back to each day after being out and about. The room butlers were always on hand and nothing was too much trouble. We will be back.

A wonderful experience. 3 nights in Raffles was a combined birthday present from my wifes siblings to us. This included accommodation for our 3 adult children. The experience was one we will not forget. From our personal butlers who took us to our rooms and explained where everything was and what was available the outlay of the rooms the pillow menu the amazing breakfast menu and the staff including the beautiful doorman who is on the posters in the Raffles shop and is possibly the most helpful staff member to every staff member we encountered we could not fault our stay. On my wifes birthday we had booked High Tea which we had attended on another occasion and she was given a lovely birthday cake and sung to as were other guests who had brith days. The manager on the day was very efficient and personable which is very comforting for patrons. As usual the High Tea provided a lot of variety and the even had a gluten free platter for my daughter. We took advantage of the serene atmosphere of the hotel and the pool and sauna facilities where we were pampered. Unfortunately 3 days still was not enough time to appreciate the full potential of the hotel.

Amazing. Out of this world luxury. Like you have been taken back 100 years. The staff are phonemalService and facilities amazing. Shops restaurants spa and pool. The suites are stunning. I struggled to leave the iconic Noel Howard suite. My tips would be Singapore Sling and Afternoon Tea are a must.

Simply amazing. My Dad booked this hotel for our stay in Singapore and it far outshone our assumptions. We originally had booked the Charlie Chaplin Suite but on arrival we were upgraded to a Grand Suite. The room was beautiful. The members of staff were extremely helpful. They answered all our questions and even recommended where we stood to watch the celebrations. The roof top swimming pool offered an oasis on calm when we were exhausted from all the exploring. As well as the stunning hotel and amazing staff the breakfast was incredible. Buffet offers an amazing choice and the al a carte menu tasted delicious.

Wow. I loved this place amazing service attention to detail and luxurious comfort. Friendly and inspirational beautiful pool and amenities. Wish I could have spent a lot longer and not been visiting for work.
Very nice service and room. I like the pool gym small.

A dream come true. Only stayed for one night but loved every second. Everyone was very accommodating ever so friendly. Gorgeous pool area with iced water beautifully chilled face towels. Loved the 2 very comfy chairs out on the veranda outside our suite where we finished our evening overlooking the Palm Court just taking it all in.

Beautiful Elegant and Charming in Equal Measure. From the moment we stepped out of the car on arrival to the moment we got in the taxi to get leave we were treated like the only clients in the hotel. Though obviously we were not. The service was continually personal and attentive while not being intrusive. The hotel room and pool were beautiful. The Bar and Billiard rooms are in need of some tlc though.

Exceeded our expectations on our first staying visit. Booking could nt get adequate information on where different suites were located needed a map. Finally got Palm Court which was lovely as a surprise for my wife on her birthday. Reception very welcoming from getting out of the taxi to receiving a Singapore Sling. Butler very informative but I must have missed the instruction on turning the bedroom fan on would be good idea if fans turned on before we are taken to romRom very comfortable and well equipped though my wife could nt find shower cap suggest put with amenities on wash basin. Nice to see Mr Singh on duty still after our first visit in 191. He is still a credit to the hotel. Nice to go back to billiard room staff very welcoming and had fun with our kids. As we were late 1000 hrs to breakfast the buffet was beginning to look sparse and dim sum cold. Waiter was a bit forgetful tea not delivered no condiments or butter on the table. Afternoon tea enjoyable in lobby part of tiffin room main part a bit noisy. Waitress forgot to deliver tea after champagne seemed to be over worked Eventually served by a supervisor. Barman very chatty and helpful. Enjoyed the Raffles shop an excellent selection of souvenirs etc. Helpful staff regarding ca nt take alcohol in hand baggage. Luckily Jim Thompson shop was nt shut with others so managed to get new shirts. Pool barman helpful. Lovely calm area. Wifess birthday Butler very kind in providing a cake but a bit wasted as very heavy chocolate I should have asked for a fruit cake fruit cake from afternoon tea would be good. The Orang Utan from towels was a great touch. Checkout very efficient. though I forgot to return keys and had to drive back to hand in suggest specifically ask for return of keys on checkoutSory to leave shame was only for 3 nights. Everyone looked after us very well. Liked the fact you restrict visitors to another entrance. Guests are after all paying for the privilege.

business stopover. everyone said you have to stay at Raffles and I am glad I did. There are plenty of other hotels and hotel rooms can be a bit of a muchness. Raffles is not. With the refurbishment I really do hope they keep the essence of the hotel as it is. The rooms are large and comfortable the bed I had was enormous. The bath was also huge and although I did not take up on the offer for the butler to run a spa bath for me perhaps I should have. The old fashioned baths need time to warm up so do not hop straight in. You need to adjust to calmer times. Raffles is a great hotel for doing nothing. Which was perfect for my trip I wanted 3 days doing nothing. I had a leisurely breakfast and the eggs Benedict are great there is fruit and heaps of pastries all fabulous. Then I stretched out by the pool which is wonderful and although you can hear the refurbishment works it is not vastly different to the sounds of the city it did not bother me. I did wander across to the Marina for the light show and had a quick look in the shops but nothing too strenuous. Supper in the grill was fine and the curry buffet was great. My butler folded all my clothes I wanted to bring him home with me. I feel I had a brief glimpse of a different and timeless era helped by the corridor with all the black and white photos of all the notable people who have stayed before. I might have to go back.

Visit for the obligatory Singapore Sling. There is currently a great deal of restoration work going on at Raffles but a visit shows the true history and grandeur of the place. The world famous Singapore Sling is currently being served in the pool and billiards bar. But this is a must do in Singapore and the works should not distract from the history. The hotel also has a great souvenir shop.

Difficult to be a snob. Raffles is still being renovated but the long bar is open. Had to queue up to get in. An overnight stay is over 10 per night. But in the Long bar they serve the very good Singapore Sling at 32 glass which was invented at Raffles and they give each table a free bag of unshelled peanuts. Of course the floor is littered with peanut shells. It makes me wonder about the larikin ruffian travellers of years gone by that had a laugh when they stayed at Raffles. It also reminds me of a cowboy bar in San Antonio Texas which was the first place that I experienced a bar floor littered with peanut shells. Raffles was originally on the beach front and guests could saunter down for a swim and return. Now Singapore has reclaimed about 25 of its area and Raffles is no longer on the beachfront. Raffles tickles my fancy.

Afternoon Tea. Booked afternoon tea with my family as a last treat before leaving Singapore. I travel there regularly and have been waiting for it to reopen for over a year. I received an email confirmation for the tea which clearly stipulated Dress code for The Grand Lobby is Casual Chic. Gentlemen are encouraged to wear shirt and trousers teamed with appropriate covered toes footwear. Ladies may be dressed in their casual best dresses skirts or trousers with appropriate footwear toes covered shoes or heels. No shorts open toes shoes or sandals pool attire is not permitted. As we were there on holiday and my son only had smart shorts with him I called to check that this would be OK. I was told its OK for children but a 15 year old risked being turned away. We therefore went out and bought smart chinos for the occasion at not an inconsiderable cost. I was then horrified to see the standard of dress allowed in the Grand Lobby. At least 4 adult men were wearing shorts. Many were in jeans and trainers. A few also in Birkenstock type sandals and t shirts. No one was turned away as I had been told. When I complained we were offered an apology and given extra desserts to take home. Half of these contained nuts which we could not eat due to allergies. I wish I had asked for the cost of the chinos bought that morning back instead. Really disappointing. Completely took the shine off our last day in this beautiful city.

A special treat with ups and downs. This was a special occasion to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and overall the stay was mixed. There were fabulous highs which met all the expectations we had of staying in Raffles. lazing by the pool the quality of in room dining the serene and sophisticated atmosphere. However three were disappointing lows which unfortunately really tarnished the overall experience primarily the room not being available to check in until 530pm despite me calling in the morning and being told it would be ready at 2 pm. When you are arriving for a 1 night special occasion and have a nice plan of how you will spend your afternoon and evening being made to wait in the courtyard and effectively lose the afternoon by the pool made it a stressful and very disappointing start. In order to still get to enjoy some time by the pool it meant I had to cancel our dinner reservations for 830pm at a fabulous Michelin star French restaurant. This was not the Raffles experience I was expecting and a free glass of champagne hardly softened the blow. The staff were all very courteous and considerate but it felt like they lacked depth of knowledge about the hotel and the operating procedures. The Butler call service was not effective and we had to wait for over 30 mins to get the butler to come after calling him twice through the ipad. He was very apologetic but this needs to be far better.

Indulgent but expensive hotel. We were returning from Europe following a 3 month vacation and wanted to stop over in Singapore a few days to re adjust our body clocks closer to Australian time. Having previously stayed at Raffles Singapore and Dubai we expected nothing but the best. The extensive and recently completed renovations have been done thoughtfully and to be honest at least to our eyes have not changed the ambience of character of the hotel. Our room a State Room King Suite was opulent large and perfect for our stay. The smoke pollution from the Indonesian fires were at dangerous levels over the period of our stay providing even more reason to utilise all the facilities at the hotel. Room service was great with a wide choice of meals and the breakfast included in our tariff was world class standard. Our only negative comment would be the 10 service fee charged to anything everything at the hotel. An example would be the room charge at SD973 had an 10 service fee of SD9730 and then the Government tax of 7. If you ordered a coffee by the pool from the Nespreso machine. the cost was SD16 including service charges and tax making it the equal most expensive Capri Italy coffee on on trip. To be fair the booking information does state clearly plus service fees and Government charges. but as these are known and fixed there is a reasonable argument for the Hotel to state the full cost for example the State Room SD113841 per night including all charges. Over a four days the extras start to add up and if you are budgeting that extra SD16541 a day starts to count. We also stayed the week leading into the Singapore F1 event so other prices were likely inflated. The chafeur pick up was included in our tariff SD75 but to book a return trip it was SD210 we chose a taxi for SD40 which was just as fine to be honest. The Spa previously located near the pool is now situated downstairs in the Raffles Arcade. We did not use it this time and our only comment would be that he location is not as convenient as polside and within the hotel. Pros. Luxury accommodation great food great facilities central location attentive helpful staff. great stop over for a few days on the way to or returning from Europe. Cons Expensive but you probably know that when you book added charges such as service and taxes not automatically shown in room and other costs.

Great stay at the iconic Raffles. Wonderful hotel with unique charm amazing rooms great butler service but slightly random pool area and service. Check in and in room service were exemplary. The pool was a little odd. The umbrellas were too small and too few in number. The food options were limited and we were told we could not order food from the hotel restaurants downstairs. I would suggest being more flexible on this or extending the food menu with kids in mind. Stick a pizza or 2 on the bar menu at least. A privilege to say at Raffles and I am sure the minor teething troubles will be overcome soon.

Wonderful. Service was perfect. Two areas to improve signage direction to anywhere eg pool bar dining finish installing all the restaurants. Room for improvement overall options quality etc. not bad just incomplete. Pool bar service under served.

Great legacy hotel with some small nits. Outstanding service great heritage surroundings excellent renovation but some post renovation snags need to be addressed key cards had to be re programmed twice the lock once and the dead bolt on the room door would not close for example. In terms of design the one major flaw is the disappointing gym fitness area which is clearly a last minute thought unsatisfactory as it is both split up into three sections and effectively on the way to from the pool as well as not being very well equipped for a hotel of this standard.

Exactly what I expected from a first class hotel. Extremely helpful staff from the moment we arrived very early 630am until we left. On arrival we were offered complimentary breakfast and later a drink in the pool bar as our room was n’t ready. Every member of staff was charming and helpful.

The Renovations are GREAT. The hotel is a real Gem. Breakfest Lunch and Dinner are really great. The afternoon tea was also really great with scones that I keep on dreaming about. The renovated rooms are to fantastic. The staff is so welcoming and professional. I wanted to stay longer. The gym is modern and does it job but the pool is spectaular. Wow I loved everything about the hotel.

was overall well except for the pool incident. i fell dangerously in the poldespite the pool having a sign saying we should be careful i entered the pool keeping the raildespite this i fell it was slippery and no friction on the tilesi injured my foot badly needing treatment on arrival back in Cape Towni am glad the patrons were prevented from entering the pool from the stairs after my fall.

Stunning beautiful hotel. We just got home from a week of staying at the Grand Dame. She really is a beautiful hotel. Yes there was some filming at the hotel it was actually fun to watch. The pool was closed we were taken across the road which was fine. Check in was quick and easy in our room. The rooms we had two courtyard rooms were beautiful. Can not fault any member of staff. Everybody was friendly and professional. Not one issue anywhere. Cant fault this beautiful hotel. We will be back.
